CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper August 9, 1947, pg. 4, reads: "Revives Lad - Ambulance Patrolman John B. Pektas, who was recently appointed to replace a vacancy on the ambulance at Centre Avenue Station, but who is an expert on 'first-aid' as long regular member of the Center Avenue Station's ambulance crew, Tuesday revived 11-year-old John Polk, 2518 Hallett Street, when he was overcome while swimming at Centre Avenue YMCA pool. Dr. K. Israel of Passavant Hospital treated the lad, following his resuscitation. Passavant Hospital reopened daytime treatment of police emergency cases last week. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police ambulance patrolman John B. Pektas posed with hand on shoulder of John Polk after swimming accident
